G.T.5538
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 29th AUGUST, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
South of the S0MME we have continued to press the enemy and have taken HERBECOURT, ASSEVILLERS and BELLOY.
North of the SOMME we have advanced towards HEM. From there to FONTAINE-LES CROISILLES there is no change in the situation.
Astride the SCARPE yesterday evening we repulsed heavy counter-attacks, and we still hold VIS-EN-ARTOIS, REMY WOOD, B0IRY, JIGSAW WOOD and FELVES, and are on the top of GREENLAND HILL. We have withdrawn slightly our posts which were established west of O?Y village.
The number of prisoners captured by us since the 21st inst. exceeds 26,000 and we have taken over 100 guns.
French Front.
North east of SOISSONS the French have captured ST. MEDARD. The French line north of NOYON now runs :- BEAURAINS, BEAULIEU, LIBERMONT, BREUIL, ROUY, thence north along the canal to EPERNANCOURT, joining the British north of LICOURT.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is no change in the situation.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
29th August, 1918.
Issued at 12.45 p.m.
